name: fortinet-fortiweb-cloud
label: Fortinet FortiAppSec Cloud
description: FortiAppSec Cloud simplifies and strengthens application security and delivery across hybrid and cloud environments. This SaaS platform secures network availability and accelerates application performance while delivering consistent security.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: Specify the URL of the FortiAppSec Cloud server to connect and perform automated operations.
fields.name: server_url
fields.tooltip: Specify the URL of the FortiAppSec Cloud server to connect and perform automated operations.

fields.title: API Key
fields.description: Specify the API key to access the endpoint to connect and perform the automated operations
fields.name: api_key
fields.tooltip: Specify the API key to access the endpoint to connect and perform the automated operations

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified. By default, this option is selected, i.e., set to true.
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.tooltip: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified. By default, this option is selected, i.e., set to true.

operations.title: Get Incident Dashboard Details
operations.description: Retrieves information for the global setting configurations from FortiAppSec Cloud based on the widget name, action name, and other filter criteria you have specified.

parameters.title: Widget Name
parameters.description: Select the name of the widget based on which to filter the incident dashboard retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud. You can choose from the following options: Threats Timeline, Incidents Timeline, Country, Attack Type, High Risk, or Http Host.
parameters.tooltip: Select the name of the widget based on which to filter the incident dashboard retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud. You can choose from the following options: Threats Timeline, Incidents Timeline, Country, Attack Type, High Risk, or Http Host.
parameters.name: widget_id

parameters.title: Action Name
parameters.description: Select the action name based on which to filter the incident dashboard retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud. You can choose from the following options: All, Block, or Monitor.
parameters.tooltip: Select the action name based on which to filter the incident dashboard retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud. You can choose from the following options: All, Block, or Monitor.
parameters.name: action

parameters.title: Host Name
parameters.description: Specify the name of the host based on which to retrieve information from FortiAppSec Cloud.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the host based on which to retrieve information from FortiAppSec Cloud.
parameters.name: host

parameters.title: Time Range
parameters.description: Specify the time range during which the incidents were created in FortiAppSec Cloud, and from to retrieve incident dashboard details. Note: Could be one of 24h, 240h (10 days) or 720h (30 days)
parameters.tooltip: Specify the time range during which the incidents were created in FortiAppSec Cloud, and from to retrieve incident dashboard details. Note: Could be one of 24h, 240h (10 days) or 720h (30 days)
parameters.name: time_range

operations.title: Get Incidents List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all incidents from FortiAppSec Cloud based on the time range and other filter criteria you have specified.

parameters.title: Time Range
parameters.description: Specify the time range during which the incidents were created in FortiAppSec Cloud, and from to retrieve incident dashboard details. For example: Could be 24h, 7d, 1m, etc.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the time range during which the incidents were created in FortiAppSec Cloud, and from to retrieve incident dashboard details. For example: Could be 24h, 7d, 1m, etc.
parameters.name: time_range

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.description: Specify multiple key/value pairs in JSON format to filter incidents retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud.
parameters.tooltip: Specify multiple key/value pairs in JSON format to filter incidents retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud.
parameters.name: filter

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.description: Specify the number of results, per page, that to include in the response of this operation.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of results, per page, that to include in the response of this operation.
parameters.name: size

parameters.title: Page Number
parameters.description: Specify the page number from which to fetch incidents from FortiAppSec Cloud.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the page number from which to fetch incidents from FortiAppSec Cloud.
parameters.name: page

operations.title: Get Incident Details
operations.description: Retrieves information for a specific incident from FortiAppSec Cloud based on the incident ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident whose details are to be retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the incident whose details are to be retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud.
parameters.name: incident_id

operations.title: Get Incident Timeline Details
operations.description: Retrieves information for a specific incident timeline from FortiAppSec Cloud based on the incident ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident whose timeline details are to be retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the incident whose timeline details are to be retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud.
parameters.name: incident_id

operations.title: Get Insight Events Summary
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all insight events summary from FortiAppSec Cloud.

operations.title: Get Incident Aggregated Details
operations.description: Retrieves information for a specific incident aggregated from FortiAppSec Cloud based on the incident ID and group by parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident whose aggregated details are to be retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the incident whose aggregated details are to be retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud.
parameters.name: incident_id

parameters.title: Group By
parameters.description: Select the grouping criteria based on which to filter incident aggregated details retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud. Select Logs to get sample attack logs of a specific incident. You can choose from the following options: Logs, Attack Type, Source Country, HTTP Host, HTTP URL, Source IP, Signature CVE ID, or OWASP TOP10.
parameters.tooltip: Select the grouping criteria based on which to filter incident aggregated details retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud. Select Logs to get sample attack logs of a specific incident. You can choose from the following options: Logs, Attack Type, Source Country, HTTP Host, HTTP URL, Source IP, Signature CVE ID, or OWASP TOP10.
parameters.name: name

operations.title: Get Insight Events
operations.description: Retrieves information for insight events from FortiAppSec Cloud based on the event type and other filter criteria you have specified.

parameters.title: Event Type
parameters.description: Select the type of the event based on which to filter insight events retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud. You can choose from the following options: Exposed Server, Trust IP, Unprotected Host, Monitor Service, or WAF Config Alarm.
parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the event based on which to filter insight events retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud. You can choose from the following options: Exposed Server, Trust IP, Unprotected Host, Monitor Service, or WAF Config Alarm.
parameters.name: type

parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.description: Specify the cursor value based on which to filter insight events retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud. Leave the cursor value empty, to list the items of the first page. Use the value of the next_cursor parameter, returned in the result of the current page, to go forward to next page. Use the value of the prev_cursor parameter, returned in the result of the current page, to go to the previous page.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the cursor value based on which to filter insight events retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud. Leave the cursor value empty, to list the items of the first page. Use the value of the next_cursor parameter, returned in the result of the current page, to go forward to next page. Use the value of the prev_cursor parameter, returned in the result of the current page, to go to the previous page.
parameters.name: cursor

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.description: Specify the number of results, per page, to include in the response of this operation. The values can be 10, 20, or 30.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the number of results, per page, to include in the response of this operation. The values can be 10, 20, or 30.
parameters.name: size

parameters.title: Forward
parameters.description: Select this option to fetch records from the next page. Clear this checkbox to fetch records from the previous page.
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to fetch records from the next page. Clear this checkbox to fetch records from the previous page.
parameters.name: forward

operations.title: Get IP Protection
operations.description: Retrieves IP protection configuration from FortiAppSec Cloud based on the application ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Application ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the application based on which you want to retrieve IP protection details from FortiAppSec Cloud.
parameters.name: epid
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the application based on which you want to retrieve IP protection details from FortiAppSec Cloud.

operations.title: Add IP Protection
operations.description: Adds an IP protection configuration in FortiAppSec Cloud based on the application ID, IP type, and IP address you have specified.

parameters.title: Application ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the application to add IP protection details in FortiAppSec Cloud.
parameters.name: epid
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the application to add IP protection details in FortiAppSec Cloud.

parameters.title: IP Type
parameters.description: Select the type of the list in which to add the IP addresses. You can choose from the following options: Trust IP, Block IP, or Allow Only IP.
parameters.name: iptype
parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the list in which to add the IP addresses. You can choose from the following options: Trust IP, Block IP, or Allow Only IP.

parameters.title: IP Address
parameters.description: Specify IP addresses to add in the selected list type. You can specify either a single IP address, or multiple IP addresses as comma-separated values or ranges. For example: 192.168.1.1, 192.168.1.2 or 192.168.1.1-192.168.14.256 or 192:168::20:1-192:168:30:150. Note: These IP addresses are added to the list selected in the IP Type parameter.
parameters.name: ipaddress
parameters.tooltip: Specify IP addresses to add in the selected list type. You can specify either a single IP address, or multiple IP addresses as comma-separated values or ranges. For example: 192.168.1.1, 192.168.1.2 or 192.168.1.1-192.168.14.256 or 192:168::20:1-192:168:30:150. Note: These IP addresses are added to the list selected in the IP Type parameter.

operations.title: Delete IP Protection
operations.description: Deletes a specific IP protection configuration from FortiAppSec Cloud based on the application ID, IP type, and IP address you have specified.

parameters.title: Application ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the application to delete associated IP protection details from FortiAppSec Cloud.
parameters.name: epid
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the application to delete associated IP protection details from FortiAppSec Cloud.

parameters.title: IP Type
parameters.description: Select the type of the list from which to delete the IP addresses. You can choose from the following options: Trust IP, Block IP, or Allow Only IP.
parameters.name: iptype
parameters.tooltip: Select the type of the list from which to delete the IP addresses. You can choose from the following options: Trust IP, Block IP, or Allow Only IP.

parameters.title: IP Address
parameters.description: Specify the IP address of the application being deleted from FortiAppSec Cloud.
parameters.name: ipaddress
parameters.tooltip: Specify the IP address of the application being deleted from FortiAppSec Cloud. It can be a single IP or a range of addresses (e.g., 172.22.14.1-172.22.14.256 or 10:200::10:1-10:200:10:100)

operations.title: Get Applications List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all applications from FortiAppSec Cloud based on the filter criteria you have specified.

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify key-value pairs in JSON format to filter applications retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud.
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify key-value pairs in JSON format to filter applications retrieved from FortiAppSec Cloud. The available "id" of filter are ["app_name", "domain_name", "block_mode", "platform", "owner", "data", "blocked_req", "req", "assign_to", "template_name"]
parameters.name: filter

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the number of results, per page, to include in the response of this operation. The values can be 10, 20, or 30.
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the number of results, per page, to include in the response of this operation. The values can be 10, 20, or 30.
parameters.name: size

parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a cursor value if a previous operation returned a partial result. To go forward to next page, specify the value of the next_cursor parameter from the response. To go to the previous page, specify the prev_cursor value.
parameters.name: cursor
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify a cursor value if a previous operation returned a partial result. To go forward to next page, specify the value of the next_cursor parameter from the response. To go to the previous page, specify the prev_cursor value.

parameters.title: Forward
parameters.description: Select this option to fetch records from the next page. Clear this checkbox to fetch records from the previous page.
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to fetch records from the next page. Clear this checkbox to fetch records from the previous page.
parameters.name: forward

operations.title: Update Geo IP Block List
operations.description: Blocks requests from clients from entire geographical locations based on the Application ID, Countries, and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Application ID
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the application in which to update the Geo IP Block.
parameters.name: epid
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the application in which to update the Geo IP Block.

parameters.title: Operation To Perform
parameters.description: Select the type of operation to perform on the Geo IP Block List. You can choose from the following options: Add Countries To Block List or Remove Countries From Block List.
parameters.name: operation_to_perform
parameters.tooltip: Select the type of operation to perform on the Geo IP Block List. You can choose from the following options: Add Countries To Block List or Remove Countries From Block List.

parameters.title: Countries
parameters.description: (Optional) Select one or more countries, from where to block or allow requests. NOTE: Requests from these countries are blocked or allowed as the per the selection in Operation To Perform parameter.
parameters.name: block_country_list
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select one or more countries, from where to block or allow requests. NOTE: Requests from these countries are blocked or allowed as the per the selection in Operation To Perform parameter.
options: South Georgia And The South Sandwich Islands

operations.title: Execute an API Request
operations.description: Sends an API request to any Fortinet FortiAppSec Cloud API endpoint based on specified HTTP method, endpoint, and other input parameters that you have specified, enabling flexible API interactions tailored to user needs.

parameters.name: method
parameters.title: HTTP Method
parameters.description:
Select an HTTP action for the request. You can select from the following options:  

DELETE 

GET 

PATCH 

POST 

PUT

parameters.title: Endpoint
parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.tooltip: Specify the target API URL path for example: /ta/insight/summary
parameters.description: Specify the target API URL path for the request. For example, if the website is https://example.com and URL path is https://example.com/ta/insight/summary, the endpoint would be /ta/insight/summary.

parameters.title: Query Parameters
parameters.name: query_params
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify any optional parameters to add to the URL and refine the request.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.title: Request Payload
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify data, as JSON, to be sent as the request payload (typically for POST or PUT requests).
